meanings.definition: The amount of space that a substance or object occupies.
meanings.sent1: The box had a large volume, taking up most of the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The swimming pool has a capacity of 50,000 gallons, which is its volume.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse tried to fit into the large volume of the shoebox for a nap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, increasing the volume of joy in the air.
meanings.sent5: The volume of water in the glass was just enough to quench his thirst.

meanings.definition: The loudness or intensity of sound.
meanings.sent1: The concert was so loud that the volume made my ears ring.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the volume on the radio to hear the music better.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed at full volume, demanding attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The volume of the thunder during the storm was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The volume of the singer's voice filled the auditorium with emotion.

meanings.definition: A book forming part of a work or series.
meanings.sent1: The third volume of the series was the most exciting one yet.
meanings.sent2: She borrowed the latest volume of the encyclopedia from the library.
meanings.sent3: The volume on the shelf seemed to be whispering to the other books.
meanings.sent4: His life story was like an open volume, waiting to be read by others.
meanings.sent5: The volume on ancient civilizations was filled with fascinating facts.
